version_changes.summary: Pattern usage expanded proportionally with codebase growth, path updates for new directory structure
notable_changes: match expressions increased with FFI layer
while let usage increased for async-free event processing

overview.description: FLS Chapter 5 defines patterns - constructs that match values satisfying pattern criteria. Patterns are used in let bindings, match expressions, if let, while let, function parameters, and for loops.

5.1_refutability.description: Refutability expresses the ability to match all possible values of a type. Irrefutable patterns always match; refutable patterns may fail to match.

findings.irrefutable_patterns: let bindings use irrefutable patterns (identifier, underscore)
findings.refutable_patterns: match arms and if let use refutable patterns (literals, enums, ranges)

5.1.1_identifier_patterns.description: Identifier pattern binds the matched value to a binding. Can include ref, mut keywords.

findings.simple_bindings: Extensive use of let x = ... bindings
findings.mutable_bindings: 2338 let mut bindings for mutable variables
findings.ref_patterns: 99 ref mut patterns for borrowing in patterns

5.1.2_literal_patterns.description: Literal pattern matches a literal value (bool, char, numeric, string, byte).

findings.byte_literals: b'\t', b'\n', byte strings in character handling
findings.usage: Error code matching, state machine transitions

5.1.3_parenthesized_patterns.description: Parenthesized pattern controls precedence of subpatterns.

findings.usage: Limited - used where needed for clarity

5.1.4_path_patterns.description: Path pattern matches a constant, unit enum variant, or unit struct constant.

findings.enum_variants: Some, None, Ok, Err extensively used
findings.custom_variants: Custom enum variants for error handling and state

5.1.5_range_patterns.description: Range pattern matches values within a range (half-open, inclusive, exclusive).

findings.usage: Character classification, numeric ranges, priority matching

5.1.6_reference_patterns.description: Reference pattern dereferences a pointer being matched.

findings.usage: Limited direct use - ref keyword in identifier patterns more common

5.1.7_rest_patterns.description: Rest pattern (..) matches zero or more elements not already matched.

5.1.8_slice_patterns.description: Slice pattern matches arrays of fixed size and slices of dynamic size.

5.2_struct_patterns.description: Struct pattern matches enum values, struct values, or union values.

findings.enum_matching: Extensive use for Result and Option
findings.union_matching: NEW in v0.8.0 - for FFI unions

5.2.1_record_struct_patterns.description: Record struct pattern matches enum variant values, struct values, or union values with named fields.

findings.shorthand_deconstructor: ref mut handle pattern for mutable borrowing

5.2.2_tuple_struct_patterns.description: Tuple struct pattern matches tuple enum variant values or tuple struct values.

5.2.3_tuple_patterns.description: Tuple pattern matches a tuple satisfying all subpattern criteria.

findings.usage: Limited explicit tuple destructuring - more common with struct types

samples.code: let mut contained_values: Vec<(u32, usize)> = vec![];

5.2.4_underscore_patterns.description: Underscore pattern matches any single value without binding.

findings.usage: Wildcard binding, ignoring values, catch-all match arms

5.3_binding_modes.description: Binding modes determine how matched values are bound: by value, by reference, or by mutable reference.

findings.by_value: Default binding mode - moves or copies value
findings.by_mutable_reference: 99 ref mut patterns for mutable borrow

samples.code: if let FdHandleEntry::UdsDatagramSocket(ref mut s) = *self.fd2handle[fd as usize].get()

5.4_pattern_matching.description: Pattern matching process involving a pattern and a context value.

findings.if_let: 337 if let expressions for conditional pattern matching
findings.while_let: 70 while let expressions for loop with pattern matching

5.4.1_identifier_pattern_matching.description: Identifier pattern matching binds context value to the binding.

findings.usage: Fundamental pattern - every let binding uses this

5.4.2_literal_pattern_matching.description: Literal pattern matching compares literal with context value for equality.

findings.usage: Exact value matching in match arms

5.4.3_parenthesized_pattern_matching.description: Parenthesized pattern matching performs pattern matching with subpattern.

5.4.4_path_pattern_matching.description: Path pattern matching compares constant/enum variant with context value.

5.4.5_range_pattern_matching.description: Range pattern matching checks if context value falls within range bounds.

5.4.6_reference_pattern_matching.description: Reference pattern matching dereferences context value and matches subpattern.

5.4.7_slice_pattern_matching.description: Slice pattern matching matches array/slice elements against subpatterns.

5.4.8_record_struct_pattern_matching.description: Record struct pattern matching matches struct fields against subpatterns.

5.4.9_tuple_struct_pattern_matching.description: Tuple struct pattern matching matches tuple struct fields against subpatterns.

5.4.10_tuple_pattern_matching.description: Tuple pattern matching matches tuple fields against subpatterns.

5.4.11_underscore_pattern_matching.description: Underscore pattern matching matches context value unconditionally.

findings.usage: Exhaustive pattern matching on enums and values

if_let_expressions.description: Refutable patterns in if let for conditional binding

samples.code: if let FdHandleEntry::UdsDatagramSocket(ref mut s) = *self.fd2handle[fd as usize].get()

while_let_expressions.description: Refutable patterns in while let for iterative matching

findings.usage: Processing streams, queues, and iterators - critical for async-free event processing

or_patterns.description: Alternation patterns using | for multiple match options

findings.usage: Error code grouping, character class matching

matches_macro.description: matches! macro for boolean pattern matching without binding

findings.usage: Conditional checks on pattern match results

match_guards.description: Match arms with if guards for additional conditions

findings.usage: Limited use - additional runtime conditions on patterns

pattern_safety_features.type_checked: All pattern types verified at compile time

binding_mode_safety.ref_mut_patterns: 99 mutable borrow patterns in pattern context
